text: Elbert Howard (January 5, 1938 â€“ July 23, 2018),Elbert Howard (2005) Panther on the Prowl better known as Big Man, was an American civil rights activist and author. He was one of the founding members of the Black Panther Party.Lise Pearlman (February 1, 2012) The Sky's the Limit: People v. Newton, The REAL trial of the 20th Century?Regent PressCurtis J. Austin (March 1, 2008) Up Against the Wall: Violence in the Making and Unmaking of the Black Panther Party University of Arkansas Press After leaving the party in 1974, Howard returned to Tennessee. In Memphis, he served on the boards of directors of several African American progressive educational institutions. Howard died on July 23, 2018 in Santa Rosa, California, aged 80. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Educators from Tennessee Category:American civil rights activists Category:American political writers Category:Writers from Tennessee Category:Writers from California Category:Educators from California
title: Elbert Howard
